2 Corinthians__05.1: For we know, if our earthly house of this habitation be dissolved, that we have a building of God, a house not made with hands, eternal in heaven.
2 Corinthians__05.2: For in this also we groan, desiring to be clothed upon with our habitation that is from heaven.
2 Corinthians__05.3: Yet so that we be found clothed, not naked.
2 Corinthians__05.4: For we also, who are in this tabernacle, do groan, being burthened; because we would not be unclothed, but clothed upon, that that which is mortal may be swallowed up by life.
2 Corinthians__05.5: Now he that maketh us for this very thing, is God, who hath given us the pledge of the Spirit.
2 Corinthians__05.6: Therefore having always confidence, knowing that, while we are in the body, we are absent from the Lord.
2 Corinthians__05.7: (For we walk by faith, and not by sight.)
2 Corinthians__05.8: But we are confident, and have a good will to be absent rather from the body, and to be present with the Lord.
2 Corinthians__05.9: And therefore we labour, whether absent or present, to please him.
2 Corinthians__05.10:
For we must all be manifested before the judgement seat of Christ, that every one may receive<u>
                the proper things of the body
               </u>, according as he hath done, whether it be good or evil.
2 Corinthians__05.11: Knowing therefore the fear of the Lord, we use persuasion to men; but to God we are manifest. And I trust also that in your consciences we are manifest.
2 Corinthians__05.12: We commend not ourselves again to you, but give you occasion to glory in our behalf; that you may have somewhat to answer them who glory in face, and not in heart.
2 Corinthians__05.13: For whether we be transported in mind, it is to God; or whether we be sober, it is for you.
2 Corinthians__05.14: For the charity of Christ presseth us: judging this, that if one died for all, then all were dead.
2 Corinthians__05.15: And Christ died for all; that they also who live, may not now live to themselves, but unto him who died for them, and rose again.
2 Corinthians__05.16:
Wherefore henceforth,<u>
                we know no man according to the flesh
               </u>. And if we have known Christ according to the flesh; but now we know him so no longer.
2 Corinthians__05.17: If then any be in Christ a new creature, the old things are passed away, behold all things are made new.
2 Corinthians__05.18: But all things are of God, who hath reconciled us to himself by Christ; and hath given to us the ministry of reconciliation.
2 Corinthians__05.19: For God indeed was in Christ, reconciling the world to himself, not imputing to them their sins; and he hath placed in us the word of reconciliation.
2 Corinthians__05.20: For Christ therefore we are ambassadors, God as it were exhorting by us. For Christ, we beseech you, be reconciled to God.
2 Corinthians__05.21:
Him, who knew no sin, he hath made<u>
                sin for us
               </u>, that we might be made the justice of God in him.
